title: Container Inner - Usage Examples
description: Advanced column container with sticky positioning, flexbox controls, and backdrop filters. Must be used inside tpgb/tp-container parent block for proper flex layout structure.

examples.name: Two-Column 50/50 Layout (Basic)
examples.description: Standard half-width column with padding, perfect for side-by-side content
examples.visualDescription: Half-width column (50% desktop, 100% mobile) with purple gradient background and white padding
examples.useCase: Standard two-column layouts, split hero sections, feature comparisons
warnings: Width uses responsive percentages: md: 50% = half width on desktop, xs: 100% = full width on mobile
Must be inside tpgb/tp-container parent for proper flex layout
Use pairs of 50/50 columns for equal splits, or 66.67/33.33 for 2:1 ratios

examples.name: Three-Column 33/33/33 Grid
examples.description: One-third width column for three-column grids with responsive stacking
examples.visualDescription: Third-width column (33.33% desktop, 50% tablet, 100% mobile) with white background and box shadow
examples.useCase: Feature grids, service offerings, team member cards, pricing tiers
warnings: Use THREE of these columns inside one container for 33.33/33.33/33.33 layout
Responsive: md: 33.33% (3 columns), sm: 50% (2 columns), xs: 100% (1 column stacked)
Add Margin right/left for gutters between columns
examples.responsivePattern: Desktop: 3 columns | Tablet: 2 columns | Mobile: 1 column stacked

examples.name: Sticky Sidebar (25% Desktop-Only)
examples.description: Fixed-position sidebar that sticks while scrolling on desktop, stacks on mobile
examples.visualDescription: Quarter-width sidebar on desktop with sticky positioning 100px from top, light gray background, full-width on mobile
examples.useCase: Blog sidebars, navigation menus, table of contents, filter panels
warnings: CRITICAL: stickycol: true enables sticky positioning
topSpace/botSpace control offset from top/bottom edges (default 40px)
stickyDes: true (desktop), stickyTab: false (tablet), stickyMob: false (mobile) for responsive control
sttopoffet: responsive top offset (handles WP admin bar automatically with +32px)
Pair with 75% width main content column for 25/75 sidebar layout
examples.stickyNote: WordPress admin bar adds 32px automatically, so topSpace: 100 becomes 132px when logged in

examples.name: Frosted Glass Card with Backdrop Blur
examples.description: Semi-transparent column with CSS backdrop-filter blur effect creating frosted glass appearance
examples.visualDescription: Half-width card with semi-transparent white background (rgba 0.8), 15px backdrop blur, rounded corners, shadow effect
examples.useCase: Hero CTAs over background images, modal overlays, testimonial cards, premium feature highlights
warnings: CRITICAL: conInnerFilter.isbackdrop: true enables backdrop-filter CSS (Webkit-only)
backdrop-filter requires semi-transparent background (rgba with alpha <1)
blur: 10-20px recommended for frosted glass effect
brightness: 105-110% for slight glow, saturate: 110-120% for vivid colors
Not supported in Firefox (falls back to normal transparent background)
examples.designTip: Use over background images for best frosted glass effect. Combine with white border (rgba 0.3) for glass edge highlight.
examples.browserSupport: Chrome 76+, Safari 9+, Edge 79+. Firefox: no support (graceful degradation to rgba background)

examples.name: Clickable Column Card with Hover Effects
examples.description: Entire column acts as a clickable link with smooth hover state transitions
examples.visualDescription: Third-width card with white background, transforms and changes shadow on hover, cursor pointer indicates clickability
examples.useCase: Product cards, service offerings, portfolio items, clickable feature boxes, call-to-action cards
warnings: CRITICAL: wrapLink: true makes entire column clickable
colUrl requires url property, target: '_blank' for external links
Hover state changes apply to entire column (bg, border, shadow)
Add cursor: pointer via customClasses for better UX
Don't nest other clickable elements inside (causes nested link issues)
examples.accessibilityNote: Entire column acts as <a> tag. Use descriptive text content for screen readers.

examples.name: Flexbox Column - Vertical Stacking with Gap
examples.description: Column container with flex-direction: column, controlling vertical alignment and spacing of children
examples.visualDescription: Half-width column with children stacked vertically, 20px gap between items, centered alignment
examples.useCase: Vertical navigation menus, stacked cards, form layouts, mobile-first designs
warnings: flexDirection: 'column' stacks children vertically (default is 'row' horizontal)
flexAlign: 'center' centers children horizontally within column
flexJustify: 'flex-start' aligns children to top (use 'center' for vertical centering)
flexGap: '20' creates 20px space between all child elements
minHeight sets minimum column height (useful for empty/sparse columns)

flexboxOptions.flexJustify: flex-start | center | flex-end | space-between | space-around | space-evenly

examples.name: Advanced Flexbox - Custom Child Sizing with flexChild
examples.description: Precise control over child element sizing using flex-grow, flex-shrink, flex-basis, and order
examples.visualDescription: Column with 3 children: first child grows 2x, second baseline 1x, third child has custom 40% basis, responsive reordering
examples.useCase: Dashboard layouts, complex card grids, pricing tables with variable widths, responsive content prioritization
warnings: CRITICAL: showchild: true required to enable flexChild controls
flexChild is ARRAY mapping to nth-child CSS selectors (child1 = :nth-child(1), child2 = :nth-child(2))
flexGrow: how much child grows relative to siblings (2 = double size of 1)
flexShrink: how much child shrinks when space constrained (0 = never shrink)
flexBasis: initial size before grow/shrink (40% = starts at 40% width)
flexOrder: visual order (3 appears last even if first in HTML, 1 appears first)
flexselfAlign: overrides parent flexAlign for individual child

flexChildExplained.flexGrow: 0 = no growth, 1 = grow equally, 2 = grow twice as much as siblings
flexChildExplained.flexShrink: 0 = never shrink, 1 = shrink equally with siblings
flexChildExplained.flexBasis: auto = content size, 50% = half container width, 300px = fixed 300px
flexChildExplained.flexselfAlign: auto | flex-start | center | flex-end | stretch (overrides parent flexAlign)
flexChildExplained.flexOrder: -1 = first, 0 = default, 1 = after 0, 2 = after 1 (visual reordering without changing HTML)

commonPatterns: Sidebar layout: Main content flexGrow: 2, Sidebar flexBasis: 300px flexGrow: 0
Priority cards: Important card flexOrder: -1 (shows first), others flexOrder: 0
Responsive images: Image flexShrink: 0 (never shrink), text flexShrink: 1 (shrinks first)

examples.name: Asymmetric Two-Column (66.67/33.33) with Reverse Mobile
examples.description: Two-thirds width main content column with responsive flex-reverse for mobile content prioritization
examples.visualDescription: Two-thirds width column on desktop, reverses to appear below on mobile, purple accent border left
examples.useCase: Blog posts with sidebar, product detail pages, landing page content sections
warnings: Use with 33.33% width sidebar column for 66.67/33.33 asymmetric layout
Responsive: md: 66.67% (main content), xs: 100% (stacks full width)
Parent container flexDirection controls column order (use flexDirection.xs: 'column-reverse' on parent)
ZIndex: 1 ensures this column appears above siblings when overlapping
Border shorthand: 'transparent transparent transparent #667eea' = top right bottom left (only left border)
examples.parentContainerNote: Set parent tpgb/tp-container flexDirection: {xs: 'column-reverse'} to reverse mobile order
examples.borderShorthand: border: 'top right bottom left' color values (use 'transparent' for invisible sides)

validationRules.Width: Required object with md/sm/xs and unit (% or px)
validationRules.stickycol: Boolean, must be true to enable sticky features
validationRules.wrapLink: Boolean, must be true to enable colUrl click functionality
validationRules.colUrl: Required when wrapLink: true, object {url, target, nofollow}
validationRules.showchild: Boolean, must be true to enable flexChild array controls
validationRules.flexChild: Array of objects, each with _key and flex properties (flexGrow, flexShrink, etc.)
validationRules.conInnerFilter: Requires openFilter: true and isbackdrop: true for backdrop-filter CSS

warnings: CRITICAL: Must be used inside tpgb/tp-container parent block for proper flex layout
Width percentages should add up to 100% for proper layouts (e.g., 50% + 50%, 33.33% + 33.33% + 33.33%)
stickycol requires topSpace/botSpace values and device-specific sticky flags (stickyDes/stickyTab/stickyMob)
wrapLink creates entire column as clickable link - avoid nesting other clickable elements
flexChild array index matches child element order (child1 = first element, child2 = second, etc.)
conInnerFilter backdrop-filter only works in Chrome/Safari/Edge (Firefox fallback to rgba background)
ZIndex controls stacking order - higher values appear above lower values
flexDirection: 'column' changes layout from horizontal to vertical stacking

architectureNote.purpose: Inner column container with advanced features (sticky, flexbox, backdrop-filter)
architectureNote.difference: tp-container-inner vs tp-column: Inner has sticky positioning, flex controls, backdrop filters. Column is simpler grid-based.
architectureNote.usage: Use Container Inner for advanced layouts with sticky sidebars, flexbox control, or frosted glass effects. Use tp-column for simple grid layouts.

troubleshooting.solution: Ensure parent is tpgb/tp-container, check Width percentages add up to â‰¤100%, verify parent has flexDirection: 'row'
Set stickycol: true, enable appropriate sticky flags (stickyDes/stickyTab/stickyMob), set topSpace value
Set conInnerFilter.isbackdrop: true, use semi-transparent background (rgba with alpha <1), check browser support (not Firefox)
Set wrapLink: true and provide colUrl with valid url property
Set showchild: true, ensure flexChild array indices match child element positions
Check Width percentages don't exceed 100%, verify Margin values aren't too large, check parent container width

accessibilityNotes.wrapLink: Entire column becomes <a> tag - ensure meaningful text content for screen readers
accessibilityNotes.focusIndicator: Add custom CSS for focus states when using wrapLink for keyboard navigation
accessibilityNotes.semanticHTML: Column itself is div, doesn't affect heading hierarchy inside
accessibilityNotes.colorContrast: Ensure 4.5:1 contrast ratio for text over background colors/gradients

performanceNotes.stickyPositioning: CSS position: sticky is GPU-accelerated and performant
performanceNotes.backdropFilter: backdrop-filter is GPU-intensive - use sparingly (max 3-5 per page)
performanceNotes.flexbox: Modern flexbox is highly performant, prefer over float-based layouts
performanceNotes.zIndex: Keep zIndex values reasonable (1-999), avoid extreme values (9999)
